title: AI-Powered Compliance Scanner - Accuracy and Real-time Analysis
description: Verify that the AI-Powered Compliance Scanner performs automated compliance scanning with 99.9% accuracy for WCAG 2.1, GDPR, and HIPAA standards, providing real-time compliance scoring and instant analysis results.

steps.description: Navigate to the Compliance Scanner interface on the dashboard.
Upload or link a test website designed with known compliance issues for WCAG 2.1, GDPR, and HIPAA.
Trigger an immediate compliance scan.
Verify the scan completes without errors and displays a compliance score.
Check that detected compliance issues match the known issues with an accuracy exceeding 99.9%.
Ensure real-time analysis updates dynamically during scanning.

title: AI-Powered Compliance Scanner - Authentication Handling
description: Ensure that the compliance scanner handles authentication correctly, avoiding 400 errors and deprecated Props warnings and enforcing role-based access.

steps.description: Attempt to use the compliance scanner features as an unauthenticated user.
Verify access is denied or limited as per design without causing 400 errors.
Log in with a user role permitted to run scans.
Run a compliance scan and monitor network responses for errors or deprecated props.
Verify no 400 errors occur, all properties are up-to-date, and results are returned successfully.

title: Security Engine Suite Accessibility and Functionality Without Authentication
description: Confirm that all 12+ security tools like Port Scanner, SSL Checker, DNS Analyzer, Password Strength Analyzer, and Hash Identifier are accessible and fully functional without requiring user authentication.

steps.description: Navigate to the Security Engine Suite page without logging in.
Select each security tool one by one and perform typical scans or checks using valid inputs.
Verify each tool executes successfully and returns expected results.
Confirm no redirect to login or authentication errors are shown.

title: User Authentication with Clerk.js - JWT and Role-Based Access
description: Validate secure user authentication flow using Clerk.js with JWT tokens, ensuring proper session management, role-based access enforcement, and absence of authentication errors (e.g., 400 or deprecated props).

steps.description: Navigate to the login page and sign in with valid user credentials.
Verify successful login and receipt of valid JWT token.
Attempt to access role-restricted pages with the authenticated session.
Verify access is granted or denied correctly based on user role.
Log out and verify the session is terminated securely.
Check no residual tokens or session data remain.

title: Project Management - CRUD Operations and Team Collaboration
description: Test the ability to create, read, update, and delete multiple projects (websites), assign team roles with permissions, and verify authentication blocking is handled correctly.

steps.description: Log in as a user with project management permissions.
Create a new project with valid data and assign team members with distinct roles.
Verify the project appears in the projects list with correct details and assigned roles.
Update project details and modify team member roles.
Confirm updates are saved and reflected in the UI and backend.
Delete an existing project.
Verify the project is removed from the list and database.
Attempt project management actions without authentication.
Check proper authentication blocking with clear user feedback.

title: Real-time Monitoring - Alerts and Status Tracking
description: Verify that continuous website monitoring sends real-time alerts, updates website status on the monitoring dashboard, and handles authentication properly.

steps.description: Log in and navigate to the Monitoring page.
Add websites to monitoring and trigger health status changes artificially.
Confirm alerts are sent immediately and displayed in the notification system.
Verify the Monitoring dashboard correctly displays current status and historical health trends.
Logout and access the monitoring endpoint.
Ensure authentication blocks access and proper error messages are presented.

title: Scheduled Scans - Recurring Scan Automation and Customization
description: Test scheduled scans functionality including creation, customization of recurrence, execution of scans on time, and proper authentication enforcement without blocking.

steps.description: Log in and navigate to Scheduled Scans.
Create a new scheduled scan with a customized recurring schedule.
Verify the scheduled scan appears with correct settings.
Wait or simulate the scheduled scan execution time.
Confirm the scan runs automatically and produces expected results.
Attempt to access scheduled scan features without authentication.
Ensure no blocking errors occur, or proper authentication flows are prompted.

title: Comprehensive Reports - Compliance Scores and Recommendations Display
description: Verify that comprehensive reports correctly present compliance scores, security metrics, and actionable recommendations with no authentication issues or data leakage.

steps.description: Log in and perform scans on projects.
Navigate to the Reports page for each project.
Check the presence of detailed analysis with accurate compliance scores and security metrics.
Verify recommendations are actionable and clearly presented.
Try accessing reports without authentication.
Ensure reports cannot be accessed and proper error handling occurs.

title: AI Assistant Widget - Availability, Functionality, and Error Handling
description: Ensure the AI Assistant Widget is accessible from the homepage, provides relevant user guidance, and handles any internal errors gracefully without disrupting the user experience.

steps.description: Navigate to the homepage.
Verify the AI Assistant Widget is visible and interactive.
Interact with the widget by asking typical user questions.
Confirm relevant and helpful responses are provided.
Simulate backend failures or disconnections for the AI service.
Check the widget handles errors gracefully, displaying user-friendly error messages without crashing.

title: Donation System - Ko-fi Integration and Button Functionality
description: Test the donation system integration with Ko-fi, verifying that donation buttons function correctly, redirect users as intended, and navigation flows do not break.

steps.description: Navigate to the Donation page.
Click on the Ko-fi donation button.
Confirm the user is redirected to the Ko-fi donation page without errors.
Test navigation back to the platform after donation interaction.
Ensure smooth navigation and no broken links.

title: Loading and Error Handling - UI States and Clerk.js Timeouts
description: Validate comprehensive UI loading states, error boundaries including 404 pages, global errors, authentication timeouts from Clerk.js, and user feedback mechanisms function correctly.

steps.description: Trigger data loading in various components like Dashboard, Reports, and Monitoring.
Verify loading indicators display appropriately.
Simulate server errors and non-existent routes to trigger error screens.
Confirm error boundaries display and provide meaningful messages to the user.
Simulate Clerk.js authentication timeout scenarios.
Check that the system prompts re-authentication and handles session expiry smoothly.

title: Modal System - Reusability and Authentication Blocking Prevention
description: Verify all modals for project, scan, and website management are reusable, responsive, and do not cause authentication blocking or UI inconsistencies.

steps.description: Trigger each modal type: CreateProjectModal, EditProjectModal, DeleteProjectModal, AddWebsiteModal, EditWebsiteModal, DeleteWebsiteModal, ScanOptionsModal, and ScheduleScanModal.
Confirm modals open and close correctly with smooth animations and responsivity.
Interact with modal forms ensuring validation errors are shown appropriately.
Attempt to open modals while unauthenticated.
Check no authentication blocking issues occur; user is redirected or prompted to log in as designed.

title: Notification System - Real-time Alerts and Authentication Security
description: Ensure the real-time notification system delivers user alerts promptly, displays them correctly, and enforces authentication to prevent unauthorized access.

steps.description: Log in and perform actions that trigger notifications (e.g., scan completion, monitoring alert).
Verify notifications appear in real-time in the UI.
Open notification routes/endpoints without authentication.
Confirm access is denied and no notifications are leaked.

title: Security Middleware - Content Security, Input Validation, and JWT Enforcement
description: Test the backend security middleware to ensure it enforces content security policies, CORS, robust input validation, and JWT authentication with proper error handling and no bypasses.

steps.description: Send API requests with invalid or malicious inputs to various endpoints.
Verify input validation blocks bad requests and returns appropriate error responses.
Make API requests without JWT tokens to protected routes.
Confirm request is denied with authentication error.
Send requests with expired or malformed JWT tokens.
Check that requests are denied and session handling behaves correctly.
Inspect headers on responses for content security policies and CORS enforcement.
Ensure security headers are present and properly configured.

title: Performance and Scalability Testing - Load Balancing, Caching, and Database Indexing
description: Assess the system's performance and scalability by simulating multiple concurrent users, ensuring caching mechanisms, load balancing, and database indexing handle the load without degradation.

steps.description: Simulate concurrent logins and usage of key features like project management, scanning, and reporting.
Monitor response times and throughput to ensure stable and performant behavior.
Verify caching mechanisms reduce backend database calls appropriately.
Check database indexes are used effectively via query performance monitoring.
Test load balancing by distributing traffic across instances.
Ensure no single point of failure and consistent user experience.
